column4: Did you flip the wireless switch or press the enable/disable button on your computer?
It gets the firmware during setup, but not during regular boot.
What does it say in the menu?
menu? You mean setup screen?
I was referring to the wireless icon menu.
Wireless is disabled
And "Enable Wireless" is checked?
where exactly is this a checkable option?
Click on the icon, it should be near "Enable Networking" if your wireless driver is running.
yes that is already checked
That will load the "wl" driver. That's actually what I am using at this moment.
That means you lack the driver... Do you have a folder in /usr/src that starts with "bcmwl"?
nope only linux-headers-2.6.35-2X folders
by any chance do you know the name of this package?
I had to look it up. It's "bcmwl-kernel-source"
now what after it finishes the command?
After the package is installed, go into the folder it creates, which starts with "bcmwl".
ok, there now
After that, "sudo make".
I got a fatal error :o about missing a file "linux/autoconf.h"
hello?
I'm not sure how to get past the autoconf.h problem. It's something I didn't encounter.
